    • Method Detail

      • standardFill

        public void standardFill()
        Fills deck with a shuffled standard deck of cards including 52 cards with 13 in each suit ranking from 0 to 12.

      • dealHand

        public Deck dealHand(int nCards)
        Deals a hand of n number of cards. Try block makes sure there are enough cards in the deck to complete hand. If there are not enough cards a message is printed.
        Parameters:
        nCards - Number of cards you want to add
        Returns:
        one hand of n cards Warning: will not overdeal cards, will end when the deck is drawn

      • drawCard

        public Card drawCard(int index)
        Draws a card from this deck, remove this card from the deck.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the card in the deck you want to remove
        Returns:
        drawn card

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        get size of deck
        Returns:
        number of cards in deck

      • addCard

        public void addCard(Card e)
        Adds a card to the deck
        Parameters:
        e - The card object that you want to add to the deck

      • deal2Hands

        public java.util.ArrayList<Deck> deal2Hands(int nCards)
        Deprecated. 
        This method is to be deprecated. Please use dealNHands method. Deals two hands of n number of cards using two decks. Try block makes sure there are enough cards in both decks to deal hand. If there are not enough cards a message is printed.
        Parameters:
        nCards - Number of cards
        Returns:
        two hands of n cards

      • dealNHands

        public java.util.ArrayList<Deck> dealNHands(Deck theDeck,
                                            int nCards,
                                            int nHands)
        Deals nHands given the deck to deal, the number of cards per deck and hands If there are not enough cards it will deal it evenly and the last extra deck contains the extra cards
        Parameters:
        theDeck - The input deck to deal to hands
        nCards - The number of cards to be dealt per hand
        nHands - The number of hands (deck)
        Returns:
        Returns the splitteddeck

      • dealNHands

        public java.util.ArrayList<Deck> dealNHands(int nCards,
                                            int nHands)
        Deals nHands given the deck to deal, the number of cards per deck and hands If there are not enough cards it will deal it evenly and the last extra deck contains the extra cards
        Parameters:
        nCards - The number of cards to be dealt per hand
        nHands - The number of hands (deck)
        Returns:
        Returns the splitteddeck

      • divideDeck

        public java.util.ArrayList<Deck> divideDeck()
        Splits deck into two equal parts and moves bottom half to top
        Returns:
        a cut deck

      • divideDeck

        public java.util.ArrayList<Deck> divideDeck(Deck deckToSplit,
                                            int numDecks)
        This will split this deck instance's deck one card at a time to different decks. If extra cards remain, it will be put into the final deck on the arrayList returned.
        Parameters:
        deckToSplit - The deck to split
        numDecks - Number of decks
        Returns:
        The splitted deck, the last deck will have the overflow

      • divideDeck

        public java.util.ArrayList<Deck> divideDeck(int numDecks)
        The deck to divide, leaves leftover cards in this deck, if not enough,
        Parameters:
        numDecks - The number of decks you want to divde the deck to
        Returns:
        Returns the splitted deck

      • sortDeckByNumRank

        public Deck sortDeckByNumRank(Deck theDeck)
        Sorts the Deck, according to the rank, does not matter what the suit is.
        Parameters:
        theDeck - Input Deck
        Returns:
        Returns sorted deck that sorts by numRank

      • sortDeckBySuit

        public Deck sortDeckBySuit(Deck theDeck,
                           java.lang.String cardType1,
                           java.lang.String cardType2,
                           java.lang.String cardType3,
                           java.lang.String cardType4)
        Method sorts the deck by suit depending on the order you would like it by the different param inputs.
        Parameters:
        theDeck - The deck you want to sort by suit
        cardType1 - Input: "Hearts", "Diamonds", "Spades", "Clubs"
        cardType2 - Input: "Hearts", "Diamonds", "Spades", "Clubs"
        cardType3 - Input: "Hearts", "Diamonds", "Spades", "Clubs"
        cardType4 - Input: "Hearts", "Diamonds", "Spades", "Clubs"
        Returns:
        Returns the deck in the order of the card Type Inputs Warning: if the input types are duplicate, it will add duplicates of the card I.E. if theDeck has 2 hearts, and you have cardType1 and cardType2 as "Hearts" the deck will have the 2 hearts twice Warning: if you do not input the correct type of card, it will not add whatever type you are missing or the incorrect type of card

      • sortDeckByRankingOfEachSuit

        public Deck sortDeckByRankingOfEachSuit(Deck theDeck,
                                        java.lang.String cardType1,
                                        java.lang.String cardType2,
                                        java.lang.String cardType3,
                                        java.lang.String cardType4)
        Method sorts the deck by suit and will be placed in order depending on the order you would like it by the different param inputs. It first sorts by rank, then sorts by suit. It will go as 2,3,4,5,6 of each suit Use
        Parameters:
        theDeck - The deck that you want to sort
        cardType1 - Input: "Hearts", "Diamonds", "Spades", "Clubs"
        cardType2 - Input: "Hearts", "Diamonds", "Spades", "Clubs"
        cardType3 - Input: "Hearts", "Diamonds", "Spades", "Clubs"
        cardType4 - Input: "Hearts", "Diamonds", "Spades", "Clubs"
        Returns:
        Returns the deck in the order of the card Type Inputs Warning: if the input types are duplicate, it will add duplicates of the card I.E. if theDeck has 2 hearts, and you have cardType1 and cardType2 as "Hearts" the deck will have the 2 hearts twice and in order Warning: if you do not input the correct type of card, it will not add whatever type you are missing or the incorrect type of card
